msItem.title: A notebook, containing the items listed under Notes.
msItem.note: A notebook containing a number of short pieces, mostly in the same hand, as follows: . (1) A collection of medical recipes and notes. 13 folios. 17 lines on a page. (2) Mahdud (Mahzuz?) al-Nisa fi Tarkib al-Hukama. On sexual activity. Inicipit: Bandah-i ad'af al-Muslimin wa ahqas al-Mu'minin 'Abdallah Ansari. This ascription is presumably false. Headings in red. 18 folios. 20 lines on a page. (3) Further medical recipes. 2+folios. (4) A rhyming Arabic,Persian and Hindustani vocabulary. Dated 9 Safar A.H. 1095. In a large hand and forming a distinct fascicle. 10 folios. 11 lines on a page. (5) A collection of distiches, preceded by circular diagrams containing the vocabulary used. Though called ruba'is the distiches are not in standard ruba'i metre. 3 folios. (6) The counsels of Nushirvan the Just and other stories and wise sayings. 3 folios. 15 lines on a page. (7) An Arabic-Persian vocabulary. 4 folios. (8). List of medical drugs. 1 folio.

listBibl.bibl: For Price's bequest see J.R.A.S., iii (1836), pp. xii-xiv, lx.

bindingDesc.p: Brown leather Indian binding with stamped decoration.

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org
